content.text: State Newton's law of gravitation

Explain whether the planets are in equilibrium

Data for some of the planets are given in Fig. 1.1
The relationship between \(R\) and \(T\) is given by the expression
A distant star is orbited by several planets. Each planet has a circular orbit with a different radius

Calculate the frequency of oscillation of the sand
frequency = .........Hz
state the position of the plate,
calculate the amplitude of oscillation
amplitude = .........mm

The amplitude of oscillation of the plate is gradually increased beyond \(8 \text{mm}\). The frequency is constant
At one amplitude, the sand is seen to lose contact with the plate
For the plate when the sand first loses contact with the plate,
A metal plate is made to vibrate vertically by means of an oscillator, as shown in Fig. 2.1
Some sand is sprinkled on to the plate
The variation with displacement \(y\) of the acceleration \(a\) of the sand on the plate is shown in Fig. 2.2
State what is meant by the internal energy of a system
Explain why, for an ideal gas, the change in internal energy is directly proportional to the change in thermodynamic temperature of the gas
A cylinder of volume \(1.8 \times 10^{4} \text{cm}^{3}\) contains helium gas at pressure \(6.4 \times 10^{6} \text{Pa}\) and temperature \(25^{\circ} \text{C}\)
Helium gas may be considered to be an ideal gas consisting of single atoms
Calculate the number of helium atoms in the cylinder
[Total: 8]
State one other use, apart from in ultrasound, of piezo-electric transducers
Explain the main principles behind the use of ultrasound to obtain diagnostic information about internal body structures
[Total: 7]
Piezo-electric transducers are used for the generation of ultrasonic waves
the direction of the orbit about the Earth,
the position of the satellite relative to the Earth's surface,
a typical frequency for communication between the satellite and Earth
frequency = .........Hz
State
Calculate the signal power received by the satellite
By reference to your answer in (i), explain why different frequencies are used for the up-link and the down-link in communication with the satellite
[Total: 8]
A signal transmitted from Earth to a satellite has an initial power of 3.0kW
The signal power received by the satellite is attenuated by 195dB
A geostationary satellite orbits the Earth with a period of 24 hours
State what is meant by electric field strength
An isolated metal sphere A of radius \(26\mathrm{cm}\) is positively charged. Sphere A is shown in Fig. 6.1
Electrical breakdown (a spark) occurs when the electric field strength at the surface of the sphere exceeds \(2.0 \times 10^{4} \text{V} \text{m}^{-1}\)
Calculate the maximum charge \(Q\) that can be stored on the sphere
A second isolated metal sphere B, also with charge \(+Q,\) has a radius of \(52\mathrm{cm}.\)
Calculate the additional charge, in terms of \(Q,\) that may be stored on this sphere before electrical breakdown occurs
additional charge = .........
Explain what is meant by the capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor
the charge, in coulomb, passing through the ammeter in 1.0s,
charge = .........C
the charge on one plate of the capacitor, each time that it is charged,
charge = .........C
the capacitance of capacitor C
capacitance = .........F
A parallel plate capacitor C is connected into the circuit shown in Fig. 7.1
When switch S is at position X, the battery of electromotive force 120 V and negligible internal resistance is connected to capacitor C
When switch S is at position Y, the capacitor C is discharged through the sensitive ammeter
The switch vibrates so that it is first in position X, then moves to position Y and then back to position X fifty times each second
The current recorded on the ammeter is \(4.5 \mu \text{A}\)
Determine
A second capacitor, having a capacitance equal to that of capacitor C, is now placed in series with C
Suggest and explain the effect on the current recorded on the ammeter
[Total: 9]
what is meant by negative feedback,
two effects of negative feedback on the gain of an amplifier
Negative feedback is often used in amplifiers incorporating an operational amplifier (op-amp)
State
Calculate the gain \(G\) of the amplifier circuit
Determine the output potential difference \(V_{\mathrm{OUT}}\) for input potential differences \(V_{\mathrm{IN}}\) of
The gain of the amplifier shown in Fig. 8.1 is constant
State one change that can be made to the circuit of Fig. 8.1 so that the amplifier circuit monitors light intensity levels, with the magnitude of the gain decreasing as light intensity increases
[Total: 9]
An ideal op-amp is incorporated into the amplifier circuit shown in Fig. 8.1
By reference to the side view of Fig. 9.1, state and explain the direction of the force on the magnets
For angle \(\theta\) equal to \(90^{\circ}\) , calculate the force on the wire
The angle \(\theta\) is changed to \(60^{\circ}\)
The length of wire in the magnetic field is \(\left(\frac{8.5}{\sin 60^{\circ}}\right)\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the force on the wire
The constant current in the wire is 5.1A
The constant current in the wire is now changed to an alternating current of frequency \(20 \text{Hz}\) and root-mean-square (r.m.s.) value 5.1A
The angle between the wire and the direction of the magnetic field is \(90^{\circ}\)
On Fig. 9.2, sketch a graph to show the variation with time \(t\) of the force \(F\) on the wire for two cycles of the alternating current
A rigid copper wire is held horizontally between the pole pieces of two magnets, as shown in Fig. 9.1
The width of each pole piece is 8.5cm
The uniform magnetic flux density \(B\) in the region between the poles of the magnets is \(3.7 \text{mT}\) and is zero outside this region
The angle between the wire and the direction of the magnetic field is \(\theta\)
The current in the wire is in the direction shown on Fig. 9.1
State Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction

An aluminium ring is placed on the core. The ring can move freely along the length of the core
The switch is initially open
Use Faraday's law and Lenz's law to explain why the aluminium ring jumps upwards when the switch is closed
